name: incoherently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is difficult to understand and does not make sense: She was muttering incoherently.
in a way that involves ideas or statements that are not connected in a sensible or clear way: The writer tries incoherently to argue his case. See
incoherent
More examplesFewer examplesDoctors struggled to establish the man's identity as he babbled incoherently.He was talking incoherently and struggling to sit up.He has a penchant for writing incoherently violent poetry.The article is full of half-baked ideas that are incoherently thrown in. The film concludes, rather incoherently, ten years later.
